title: Welcome To My Blog
text: Since this post doesn’t specify an explicit image, the first image in the post will be used in the listing page of posts.

title: Reading Data
text: There are different types of data, we won’t get into the nitty-gritty parts of it, but there is structured, semi-structured, and ustructured data. We will be playing around with structured data (think excel files). Examples of the other types of data are pictures, video, and audio files.

title: Welcome to Bootcamp
text: Welcome to Data Science Society’s R Bootcamp

title: Welcome to Bootcamp
text:
Course Outline:
Installation
What kind of data are we using?
Reading in Data

BaseR and Tidyverse
there’s a from readr option using the “import dataset” option from the environment pane

Wrangling Data

dplyr, for data manipulation
tidyr, for data tidying
cleaning, the difference between them all, and when they should all take place in the process

Visualization of Data

the glory of ggplot

```{r}
#| eval: false
#| include: false
#| message: false
#| warning: false

library(tidyverse)
iris %>%
    ggplot()+
    geom_point(aes(Sepal.Length, Sepal.Width, color = Species))+
    labs(
        title = "Title here",
        x = "Sepal Length", 
        y = "Sepal Width"
        )
```
#| eval: false
#| message: false
#| warning: false

library(tidyverse)
iris %>%
    ggplot()+
    geom_point(aes(Sepal.Length, Sepal.Width, color = Species))+
    labs(
        title = "Title here",
        x = "Sepal Length", 
        y = "Sepal Width"
        )
